docs.lead_paragraph: There are third-party alternatives to Alan G. Hevesi and J. Christopher Callaghan in the race for New York State comptroller.

headline.main: Off the Trail: Weighing Other Hevesi Challengers

docs.snippet: There are third-party alternatives to Alan G. Hevesi and J. Christopher Callaghan in the race for New York State comptroller.

docs.lead_paragraph: Frustrated by having to decide between Alan G. Hevesi and J. Christopher Callaghan, below, in the race for New York State comptroller? Well, there are alternatives, since voters can pull the lever for a third-party candidate in this race. Julia Willebrand, the Green Party candidate, has been involved with the Greens for about a dozen years. As she tells it, she grew up poor, one of 10 children in Greenpoint, Brooklyn. She has been a waitress, a college professor and a mother. She ran for State Senate on the Upper West Side in 1998 and for mayor of New York in 2001. She did not win.
docs.abstract: Campaign for New York State comptroller includes candidates other than Democrat Alan G Hevesi and Republican J Christopher Callaghan; other candidates are Julia Willebrand, Willie Cotton and John J Cain; photos (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: Catherine Jane Miller, the daughter of Mona Miller and Dr. Robert Miller of Hunt Valley, Md., was married last evening to Daniel David Lieberman, a son of Julia Lieberman of St. Louis and Isaac Lieberman of Newington, Conn. Rabbi Harold White officiated at Grey Rock Mansion, an event space in Pikesville, Md. The Rev. Michael Wallens, an Episcopal priest, participated in the ceremony.
